Reviews.Title: Excellent small form factor smartphone
Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: This is a nice phone. HP still provide great support and has mechanics to update the firmware from their site palm.com/rom I doctored it and updated with the latest firmware from HP/Palm website. I also unlocked it paying a site $17, but now there are free unlocking site available which I used for my other Paln Pre devices. I also use it without SIM using developer mode, given below. The white phone is very cute and distinguishes from the standard color. Has plenty of space for music and volume is pretty good in the internal speaker. Touchstone capabilities are awesome.  Unfortunately HP fumbled and stopped these line of products, but they are great and part of a history.Steps to bypass activation and use with just wifi: At the first screen to put SIM Card, using the keyboard type: BZ (those are the buttons for #*). dialer will appear. When the phone dialer appears use the screen to type: 3386633# and press dial. The phone will restart and you don't need a SIM card to use the phone. Use wifi for using like an ipod touch.

Reviews.Title: Best Tethering Phone
Reviews.Author: Joey Maynigo
Reviews.Content: Just like what the commercial said with Manny Pacquiao " Li'l guy can pack a punch ". Like most of the people who made their reviews about this phone, I have experienced all OS from Symbian, iOS, Android, Windows Mango and the RIM, WebOS is for me the most user friendly. This phone is so tiny but it can tether like crazy with it's 4G speed. The battery may be a bit disappointing and the App World may not have many applications but you can't expect to do much on such a small phone.Camera is ok with a good light source. You can customize many settings by downloading a third party app just like Cydia on iPhone. For me, the best benefit I got from this phone is it's tethering capabilities. If you were grandfathered with an unlimited data this phone can maximize your usage. And no, I don't feel the "throttle". I get the same consistent speed. Works great for streaming videos too.I'm planning to get another one in fact.

Reviews.Title: awesome smartphone with this price!
Reviews.Author: yl147
Reviews.Content: This phone is so cute! It easily fits in my pocket. The keyboard feels very comfortable for typing massage. Very fast when run apps. I really like the multi-task design of WebOS and how easy it is to open and close an app just by sliding my finger. This phone definitely can satisfy my basic daily needs as phone call, massage, browsing websites, check email and facebook, etc. It may not be very convenient for listening music or watching videos because you need some kind of adaptor to connect the earphones to the phone. The other concern is that the battery doesn't last quite long. It is enough for a whole day, but you'd better recharge it every night since the battery is not removable. But with this price, I think it is a high-quality smartphone.

Reviews.Title: out of the box not so great need the 2.2.4 update.
Reviews.Author: Clinton
Reviews.Content: I had problems with the light sensor during call blackout makes it unusable.I added the 2.2.4 update to the phone it corrected the light sensor problem.I also added preware to allow me to add useful items to make it better and more friendly.I am using straight talk sim card with it (no need to unlock) the apn setting are a snap to get 4g data and mms all working correctly.overall after the update the phone works great.

Reviews.Title: Great webos phone
Reviews.Author: Daniel Morrissey
Reviews.Content: When I bought the phone my first fear was that I would need to buy an unlock code. However it worked straight away out of the box, no code required. I'm in Ireland. I wish I bought two!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Artur
Reviews.Content: HP Veer is a great smartphone, has everything you need: 4G connectivity, wireless, bluetooth, GPS, etc... All these features into a small form factor which fits great on the pocket, doesn't look you are carrying on those "bricks"

Reviews.Title: Gorilla glass, gorilla shatter
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to replace the plastic screened Palm Pixi Plus. The slide out keyboard sucks. I do not like phones that have moving parts like that. But I did like the size of this and the touchstone compatibility. The 4G is fast enough and teethering using free teether was excellent. I streamed Pandora through the cellular network to my car stereo via Bluetooth and provided a hotspot to the kids Kindle Fire's. Not bad for a phone that most people laugh at when they see it. But this phone isn't about being number one. It is about not having the same thing as everyone else and not caring what other people think. I liked how small it was and how simple it was to setup. The price is right and the camera is... so-so.The screen is GLASS! This is good news for those with scratched up plastic screens. These gorilla glass screens are scratch resistant and have fantastic sensitivity for touch. But I dropped mine onto a corner and the screen shattered. Oops. But the good news. If you break the glass, it's cheap to replace the phone. Then you just swap the SIM card, log into your Palm id and your back.I do not like the magnetic headphone jack thing. I like listening to my headphones while my phone is charging. With a touchstone that's fine. But without a touchstone, you either get the headphones or the charging, not both. Oh well... Next I will buy the Palm Pre 3. See how that thing does. I am sad to see Palm phones go. WebOS was perfect for guys like me. I do not care about carrying around thousands of apps or having the fastest this or that. ITS A PHONE! Right???

Reviews.Title: palm veer 4g gsm
Reviews.Author: conrad
Reviews.Content: I hated this phone of all the phones I have purchased. It is not user friendly. Had nothing but problems with it. I got so frustrated I went back to one of my older phones and stuck this back in the box. For me this phone did not work.

Reviews.Title: HP Veer
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: It's a cute phone but it doesn't have a long battery life I hardly ever use my phone and I have to charge it daily. Also the phone freezes up sometimes if too much is going on at once. Sometimes the screen will go black and stay that way even if you slide the phone open the only way I've been able to fix that is to plug it into the charger multiple times until the screen lights up. The only reason I haven't returned it yet is because I don't have a back up phone to use during that time period.

Reviews.Title: simply the most elegant smartphone yet made
Reviews.Author: Artichoke
Reviews.Content: my daily driver since shortly after it was releasedbrilliant designgot this one as my first needs its slider adjusted after a nasty fall & a backup was in orderpaid much less for the new onethis phone does core smartphone functions (email, telephone, messaging, GPS) better than my Galaxy III S or my bro's IPhone 5certainly NOT for watching you Tube (though it does get a smooth image) or movies but WebOs and a slider with a SUPERB keyboard in a tiny, highly reliable phone make this well worth my accoladethinking about getting me a third one ;-)

Reviews.Title: Best phone ever.
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: I owned all kind of phones Windows Phone 8, Symbian, BB, iOS, Android. But this phone out of all of them is the most user friendly and comfortable.It seems like keys are small - BUT they r not, i typed messages twice faster then on any other touchscreen phone.Phone is small phone and doesn't look like u caring a TV in your pocket. WebOS is already proved to be best developers platform, and i can say it's the most flexible and easy to use from all the other mobile OS i've used. Yes it doesn't have millions and millions of apps but you can find all apps you would NEED - and most of them are free.I also own TouchPad from HP and TTS functionality is just awesome! $5 touchstone makes it easy to recharge wirelessly.Some ppl say that this phone is slow - not true. Phone is fast. As i said - WebOS is very flexable so u can accelerate it / overclock. Any phone is going to be slow if u r running 20 apps without closing processes. Also some ppl left reviews saying that it's hard to close apps - actually thats a lie - process of closing an app is easiest from any other phone - u just swiping app-card/window up.So please people - before posting negative feedback about great products - READ MANUAL and fallow instructions!

Reviews.Title: Hp veer
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: First off im writing this review because of the product and the functions.Pros - phone calls are great. Texting works. Keybord works . Screen is clear. Phone looks brand new .Cons- phone isnt updated wich means if you get the version I have u will have hardware and software problems as I did.for instance.when I made phone calls the screen shuts off and there wasnt anyway I can turn the screen on. I pressed everything and the only solution was restarting the entire phone after I made calls. texting was ok but it was really laggy.When I sent a message, it took a while for it to show up on the screen.also while I was having a conversation the messages werent showing only when I got the notification . I had to delete the convo and start a new one with that person.  Also when I try to listen to music or pandora no sound is playing sometimes. I wasn't able to use my email accounts . when I looked at the charger when I opened the box it was really dusty like. I can see it disappear as I wiped and cleaned it.just for experience i wouldn't recommend this product to any customers. And that if someone sells devices they should explain if there are problems . I give this 2 stars because it came on time and I was offerred a refund but which I do not trust . If u want something alittle more meaning try the palm pre 2 or the pre 3

Reviews.Title: nice phone
Reviews.Author: Lorrant
Reviews.Content: It's really a nice phone I love the way it operates nice graphics and smooth operations. Try it guys its really nice

Reviews.Title: Too complicated for me
Reviews.Author: vera Summers
Reviews.Content: It was very good and many things on it.  The reason I did not keep it was, I am on a limited budget and many of the things on it would cost me more than just a plain phone without texting.

Reviews.Title: Read the reviews and do your research
Reviews.Author: Caroline Crawley
Reviews.Content: I chose and ordered this particular phone because it is one of the most socially and environmentally responsible phones out there.  Sadly, I had nothing but problems.First off, it is tiny, really tiny.  The keyboard keys stick.You have to reset the date in order to update apps and download anything.Within a few weeks, a dot appeared in the middle of the screen about the size of a dime.The phone would reset itself back to Spanish and airplane mode.The supplier was good and the item arrived in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: hp palm veer
Reviews.Author: fayneff@shaw.ca
Reviews.Content: Did not like the size of this product.  Could not receive my e-mail on it and returned it before using it; however, the supplier said it was in "poor shape and used" (which it never was!?) and he did not return my entire purchase price.  That event made me dis-like the product even more!

Reviews.Title: good smartphone
Reviews.Author: malcom
Reviews.Content: Great little device, 800 mhz really can pack a punch with the venum processor! Updates are no longer going to work until you use this little trick I learned from the web OS newsletter. Set your network time and date to a manual july 1 2013, go to the app catalog and search for app catalog update its free. Once the app has installed correctly you should be able to receive updates and you can change the time and date configuration to automatically update via the network. Until you do this the phone will continue to download apps but not install them correctly.

Reviews.Title: Works and Functional
Reviews.Author: Emil E. Gray "SIObserver"
Reviews.Content: The only really bad feature is that it is very small. It works and I haven't have any trouble with it.

Reviews.Title: good at this price
Reviews.Author: satya
Reviews.Content: My wife loves this cute mobile. We have touchpad and using the same webos id, i need to check if it is good at sync.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: fishing
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone six months ago and now it can not be used any more.My veer just randomly turned off on me, and now it wont reboot.I have tried all methods suggested by my friends and could not evenstart the phone. I really don't recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: As a WebOs Fan... I Hated This Device
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I have the Palm Pixi Plus & Pre 2 and decided to try the newest of them and I was very disappointed.I love WebOs (my favorite operations system) but the hardware is terrible.The one thing I dislike about WebOs is the terrible App selection. I don't believe they have ever crossed the 5k mark.The size really was the worst thing. As a media lover I should have known better but I took a shot.the screen is really too small to do anything. Watching videos, youtube, or even browsing is terrible.I'm only 20, it's not about eyesight it's just the hassle of all the scrolling to read information terrible pixel count.The speaker was terrible and the cover for the speaker/camera quickly came off a few days later (it was poorly glued on)I'm not a big photo taker but the camera was horrible on there (& the option WebOs gives you for photos makes it no better)The keypad was small but I was able to type on it with ease. I would say I don't have small hands by any means, but it was not a problem for me.If you're like me and like WebOs You should definitely get the Palm Pre 2 or HP Pre 3

Reviews.Title: HP Veer Real Power in your PALM
Reviews.Author: Prasada R. Kolli "KP"
Reviews.Content: Hi,I am really Happy to use HP Veer 4G phone which is just the kind for any one not gaming.This phone meets all my mobile needs including word, EXCEL with some additional application software and I do not carry my laptop or touchpad.Once unlocked it works anywhere in the world.P R KOlli

Reviews.Title: Great little phone that gets it done.
Reviews.Author: Indydoc 90
Reviews.Content: The Veer is a star for me. Does everything I need. I have all the apps-calendar, shopping list, Gas Buddy, weather, news. WebOS is still far ahead of the other operating systems even without any updates for a year. I have used my Veer since August, 2011.

Reviews.Title: lovely
Reviews.Author: tosyn
Reviews.Content: stylishly perfect. tthe product arrived on time and met my expectation. it is what it is and no iphone can be better

Reviews.Title: HP Veer user experience
Reviews.Author: Kumar
Reviews.Content: The worst phone i have ever bought. The phone keeps hanging a lot, very frustrating experince, will never suggest this phone to anyone.

Reviews.Title: It's an ok smartphone
Reviews.Author: Jason Painter
Reviews.Content: Well I ordered a HP VEER because I love Web OS and the fact I could put this phone in my shirt pocket if I needed to sounded great. The phone arrived and I activated it on Straight Talk (basically AT&T; service). Lets first say the phone is very small in size and I ordered the white one and it's very very slippery. If I knew before (from reviews) I would of got the black one for more grip. Any who, the Web OS experience is about the same as before with the palms except a few diff tactics that I don't like so much. The web browser is pretty good and does have Flash Video, I was very disappointed in the camera as I knew there was no flash but the quality of pictures and camera is just bad and so is the video recorder. Now with the actual hardware its pretty spotty, when I say spotty it means the phone kind of just freezes once in a while and is pretty slow even with a 800 ram. The battery life (can not replace)on the Veer is I say the worst battery you can get except the Samsung Epic(slide keyboard). The one thing that I really cant stand with the Veer is that the phone has a "battery saving" chip in it that makes the screen dim off and on really drives me crazy that it does this and no way of turning it off unless you download Preware and use a Patch. Now with the app store- it's just plain awful!!! Yes you can get Facebook(doesn't upload), Twitter,the basics, but no Google maps, my Amazon music store will not even allow me to purchase songs, and no navigator unless you have a contract with AT&T.; On the other hand, emails load quick, the keyboard is amazing, the size is cool and fun, the call quality is decent but it depends on the Service you have. Overall the HP VEER is a very fun smartphone that is small, most of the time zippy, and def a crowd stopper. I was disappointed in the "dimming", the app store, Amazon music, and At&t; service. If I was you though I would prob go for a android I know the Veer looks cool and it is but having all the issues mostly App store, battery, and camera you can get a better phone.

Reviews.Title: perfect condition,ok phone
Reviews.Author: mespinoza
Reviews.Content: i ordered the hp veer knowing it was very small. the apps really really blow on this phone as they do on all palm phones. very small hard to text. i was surprised iwth being able to watch youtube videos. also the charging dock was great and its only like 5 bucks. but if you are replacing your android or iphone DO NOT  buy this phone. you will hate it as soon as you turn it on.

Reviews.Title: quick delivery. good phone
Reviews.Author: johndel
Reviews.Content: Everything came quickly and was as described, except the phone was not white in color as told in the product description. To some people this may have been a problem, but i have no problems with a black phone.

Reviews.Title: Great size, but sad performance
Reviews.Author: Tyler Wyatt
Reviews.Content: The HP App store is down, but it still tries to download multiple times a day, wasting my data. Thus no apps, including Google Maps.The battery sometimes decides it's good for 3 days or a couple hours.Bought this phone because it fits in a drybag for adventuring, but now have to bring a better digital camera because the phone camera is poor.If you're trying to give up all the tech of today's phones and go back to a smaller, more simpler model: get a track-phone.

Reviews.Title: impossible to jailbreak
Reviews.Author: G. Vo
Reviews.Content: the hp veer is impossible to jailbreak because the phone requires an APN from at&t.; in other words dont buy this product if u plan on jailbreaking it!! plus it's really small and very complicated to use

Reviews.Title: It is ok
Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: I wont crazy about it unless you really have a 4G networks cuz the phone itself is really complicate and the battery dont last long.

Reviews.Title: Too Small
Reviews.Author: DENISE SALAZAR
Reviews.Content: Its a lot smaller than I expected. Having Rhumatoid Arthritis & trying to use this small phone didn't work for me.

Reviews.Title: It's o.k.
Reviews.Author: Nico
Reviews.Content: I'm Android fan,but this phone is very good,I don't understood why HP retired this product,very small size,web OS it's ok.

Reviews.Title: Slow like a snail
Reviews.Author: nancypeace
Reviews.Content: The phone is slow, not only in service but the phone itself. It acts weird, turns off and won't close apps properly. Also, the HP app store sucks.

5-MP camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; 8 GB memory; HTML web browser with Flash support; corporate and personal e-mail
Up to 5 hours of talk time, up to 300 hours (12+ days) of standby time; released in May, 2011
